revised_title: Effects of Substrates on N2-Fixing Soybean Bacteroids
tldr: The authors studied the effects of different substrate concentrations on N2-fixing soybean bacteroids in a flow chamber. They found that glucose was poorly utilized, while ethanol and C4-dicarboxylates like succinate and malate had varying effects on oxygen demand and N2 fixation. The results suggest that the presence of malic enzymes and a pyruvate dehydrogenase complex in bacteroids may influence the response to these substrates.
